context.p: To perform updates on endpoints, users can configure Maintenance Mode settings to define a period when StellarEnforce allows all file executions and adds all files that are created, executed, or modified to the Approved List. During the Maintenance Mode execution period, all newly-added files will be updated accompanied with real-time virus scanning. StellarEnforce can learn the newly-added applications and ensure the execution of these applications are under protection.

step.cmd: Click the Agents tab in the top navigation bar of the StellarOne web console.
Select one or more endpoints (agents or groups) by clicking the checkboxes next to them.
Click the Protection button from the Tool Bar at the top of the Agents screen.
A pop-up window appears. Click Configure Maintenace Mode option.
The configuration window appears. Please read the notice and check either Enable or Disable radio button.

choice.p: Click Enable to start the Maintenance Mode settings. Please go to Step 7 for next procedure.
Click Disable OK to end Maintenance Mode. This will cancel the scheduled maintenance period on endpoints.

li.p:
A warning message appears.Â Please read carefully before proceeding to next step.
If the Maintenance Mode is ended, the StellarProtect will start blocking the execution of files that are not recognized by the OT Application Safeguard.
Click OK to end Maintenance Mode. A pop-up window appears showing the deployment status of stopping Maintenance Mode on endpoints.

step.cmd: The schedule configuration window appears. Do either of the following for scheduling Maintenance Mode.

choice.p: Click the Schedule radio button, and then click the edit icon to select the start date and input the start time for executing Maintenance Mode. After that, specify the duration of the maintenance period in Maintenance Mode will be ended after.
Click the Start now radio button, and then specify the duration of the maintenance period in Maintenance Mode will be ended after.

step.cmd: Click OK to deploy the settings to the selected agents or groups.
The Command Deployment window appears showing the deployment status. Click the Close button to close the window.
